## Guidelines {transition="convex"}

::: {.fragment .fade-right}
-   **Role:** Who LLM should act as
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-up style="margin-left: 30px"}
`You are a Pythonista`
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-right}
-   **Context:** Info LLM needs
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-up style="margin-left: 30px"}
`Dataframe with names & data types:`<br> `df = {name: string, dob: date, egfr: double}`
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-right}
-   **Task:** What you want LLM to do explicitly
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-up style="margin-left: 30px"}
`Write Tidyverse code visualizing numeric variable collinearity`
:::

## Guidelines {transition="none"}

::: {.fragment .fade-right}
-   **Format:** How you want the output structured
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-up style="margin-left: 30px"}
`Instructions to:`<br>\
`1. Install {uv}.`<br> `2. Create a .venv`
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-right}
-   **Constraints:** What to avoid or limits to follow
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-up style="margin-left: 30px"}
`---Do---`<br> `Return a PNG`<br> `---Do Not---`<br> `Return references without a PMID`
:::

## Guidelines {transition="none"}

::: {.fragment .fade-right}
-   **Few-Shot Prompting:** Provide example(s) of desired output/formatting
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-up style="margin-left: 30px"}
`Return CPT code definitions.`<br> `Example: CPT Code {90960}: Definition {"Comprehensive monthly dialysis for ESRD, 4+ visits"}`
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-right}
-   **Use Delimiters:** Wrap content in `"""/"""`, XML tags (`<text></text>`), or dashes (`---`)\
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-up style="margin-left: 30px"}
`Summarize this email: """[Insert Email]"""`
:::

::: {.fragment .fade-down}
[*Sources:* [Reddit](https://www.reddit.com/r/ChatGPTPromptGenius/comments/1nytjzy/best_practices_for_ai_prompting_2025), Google]{style="font-size: 0.8em; text-align: right;"}
:::

1.  Search for an active kidney-focused trial on [clinicaltrials.gov](https://clinicaltrials.gov/)

2.  Copy/paste the participation criteria into your prompt for LLM to create code identifying eligible patients in a hypothetical database

## Exercise 3

**Reporting, Visualization, & Predictive Modeling**

Copy/paste these clinical trial variable summaries into your LLM prompt to:

1.  Create a *JAMA* style Table 1

2.  Explore & visualize an important relationship(s) between predictors & `remission`

3.  Create & explain code to build multiple models predicting `remission` (remission = 1)

## Bonus Exercise

**Munging Messy Data**

1.  Download [**messy_aki**](https://github.com/higgi13425/medicaldata/raw/master/data-raw/messy_data/messy_aki.xlsx) dataset from Dr. Peter Higgins' [**{medicaldata}**](https://higgi13425.github.io/medicaldata/index.html) R package
